Course Description: PRESENTS UNDERLYING CONCEPTS AND ETHICAL, REGULATORY AND BUSINESS ENVIRONMENT OF FINANCIAL REPORTING WITH EMPHASIS ON ACCOUNTING FOR VARIOUS BUSINESS STRUCTURES AND BUSINESS COMBINATIONS.
Objectives / Learning Outcome(s) / Major:
UPON COMPLETION OF THE COURSE, STUDENTS ARE ABLE TO:
1.UNDERSTAND BUSINESS COMBINATIONS AND CONSOLIDATIONS
2.ACCOUNT FOR INTER COMPANY TRANSACTIONS
3.RECORD TRANSACTIONS DEALING WITH FOREIGN CURRENCY
4.UNDERSTAND THE ENTRIES NEEDED TO ACCOUNT FOR PARTNERSHIPS
5.DEVELOP AN UNDERSTANDING OF PARTNERSHIP AND CORPORATE LIQUIDATION
6.ACCOUNT FOR CORPORATE REORGANIZATIONS 
7.IMPROVE RESEARCH, ORAL AND WRITTEN COMMUNICATION SKILLS
8.REINFORCE THEIR ETHICAL AND PROFESSIONAL BUSINESS CONDUCT
Textbook(s):
ADVANCED ACCOUNTING, 8TH EDITION
PEARSON PRENTICE HALL
BEAMS, ANTHONY, CLEMENT, AND LOWENSOHN
ISBN 0-13-066183-X
Transfer Status: GUARANTEED TRANSFER TO INSTITUTION OFFERING SAME COURSE.
